title: (x) Transitional text face in 1956 Norwegian book - similar to Cochin {Jan E}
content:
Does anybody know the name of this transitional(?) typeface used in a norwegian book from 1956? Notice the t and the italic d. Is there a digital version available?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023160832im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sande_4280.jpg)
author: Arild

comments.content: Closest I can think of is [Cochin](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023160832/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/cochin/familytree.html).

Very nice Italic and also the rest is quite handsome.  
The Italic stroke has something that reminds me of Fournier but obviously the type is from a later epoche.  
The g, yet, is very different from Cochin feeling (which is good I think)

Stefan

Sorry for not knowing anything about it ;-)
